description: Hindi हविलदार (havildār), from Persian حوالدار‎ (havâldâr), from Arabic حَوَالَة‎ (ḥawāla, “charge”) + Persian دار‎ (dâr, “holder”).

entries.meaning: (India, Pakistan, Nepal) An noncommissioned officer rank in parts of India, later a specific military rank of the British Indian Army and of the modern armies of India and Pakistan, equivalent to sergeant.
examples: ‘There was a great fight,’ said the Havildar, ‘and of us no man escaped unhurt.’
